string.value: A tiny town, existing only by trade with passing merchants from the north.
This gas station offers some very useful services at a reasonable price.

The people of this remote village don't like outsiders.
Home sweet home.
Prosperous farming village.
This settlement is the one most often attacked by bandits.
Road to Vaterland
Road to Vahat
Road to Ridzin
Road to Krai
Road to Vaterland
Road to Vaterland
Road to Sacred Grove
Road to Argen
Road to Argen
Road to Vaterland
Road to Sacred Grove
Road to Librium
Path to Librium
Road to Librium
Road to Ignott
Road to Sacred Grove
Road to Krai
Road to Argen
Road to Zarmek
A town surrounded by farmland. It supplies all of Ridzin and a good half of Vaterland with potatoes.

The main city of the Technicians. In their own words, "the scientific capital of the reborn world". Here you can always sell ancient technology and artefacts, and with some luck you can buy a unique piece of equipment.

Contrary to popular belief, Technicians are not only hiding behind city walls, but are also looking for ways to navigate the world at higher speeds. This city, a rebuilt and fully functional port, is considered to be the first sign of a maritime revival.
Local farmers discovered an ancient warehouse nearby and switched to a career of antiquities hunting.
Farmer village.
It was once the site of a demolition derby, but now all that's left is a field covered in metal debris.
It is difficult to say what the local villagers do for a living, but they seem to be quite prosperous.
Village by the Colosseum, the ruins of the ancient amphitheatre attract many adventurers to this place.

A bridge town at the crossroads of major trade routes, it is the only place in the world that officially charges tolls. That is why various factions have been planning to snatch this neat little corner for a long time now. So far, no one has succeeded.
At first glance it is just a village lost in the middle of nowhere but it is actually the center of clandestine trade with the Occident.
A bastion of free trade and a model of what can be achieved by honest labour. A veritable fortress, ready to greet a "friendly" visit from rivals with a warm welcome from all its weapons.
The miners dig deep to find a slightest piece of precious materials or artifacts.
In spite of favorable location, this village is very poor. Maybe because it cannot compete with the large factions. Or maybe its people are just lazy.
A tiny village where nothing ever happens.
A source of oil. But also a source of wealth of the NPT.
Tons of ancient weapons are buried in the basement of this ancient military base.
Road to Krai
Road to Librium
Road to Ridzin
Road to Hel

A source of wealth for the North Path Traders’, supplying them with dozens of tons of rare goods every month, perfectly preserved in the weather conditions of Hel. Unfortunately, the native population does not always react adequately to the arrival of foreigners, so the city is very well fortified.
A fishing village by the ocean. "True fishermen never die" - a local proverb proudly states.
A village at the intersection of all roads.
Settlement by the ruins.
Even swampy soil bears bountiful fruit if it is carefully cultivated one day at a time.
A remote mining village. The locals - fishermen at heart - are upset about this situation.
A village allied with the merchants.
A valuable strategic object that is constantly changing hands from fishermen to traders and back again.
The capital of Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Within its walls strategic plans for fighting foreign invaders are born, and it is also the centre of an extensive intelligence network.
The inhabitants of this town and the surrounding villages give everything to the defence of their homeland. It is an industrial base of the CIS but also provides them with food.
CIT’s main military base, where hundreds of soldiers are on duty day and night, ready to repel any threat to civilians.
Distant village.
This settlement close to border is often being attacked by CD’s mercenaries.
People of this village are ready to give all they have to support the soldiers in the battle against the CD.
Logistics is an important part of the warfare, that’s why the locals work hard to help the army.
Headquarters of the Church of Enlightenment. Few people know what really hides behind its high walls.
Intimidated people labour here day and night to provide food for Axel's growing army of mercenaries.
Axel's underground base. Only a handful of those closest to him know its exact location. It was here that the Crimson Dawn movement once originated, eventually spreading across the entire country.
Unassailable fortress that coordinates the actions of a big gang of cutthroats that the Argen militia has turned into.
A border village, as its name suggests. However, no one remembers which border is meant anymore.
Farmers' settlement.
The inhabitants of this village sometimes have to provide services to both warring parties. However, they prefer not to advertise this.
To Vahat
Grand town of the Druids, its towers soaring into the sky like the branches of a hundred-year-old oak.
Small settlement in the middle of the forest. A nice place to hide from the storms of the outer world.
The Children of Iron, who had betrayed the faith of the Druids, rebuilt their hometown according to their own ideas of beauty.
Village of ex-brigands.
From here it is possible to travel to Hel.
Oracle’s Disciples holds here their rites in hope to attract his attention.
The hermit's house.
The capital of Vahat and the true jewel of the Oasia. Since ancient times this city has been known for its unsurpassed gunsmiths and architects.
The once prosperous town has fallen into disrepair in the last few years. It still retains traces of the former greatness, though.
Townspeople organize spectacular races for everyone willing to participate. Unfortunately, not many people manage to come to this place.
Small town on the edge of the Desert of Death has witnessed a lot of strange and terrible events.
Ancient port at the shore of the dead sea. Dozens of ships that will never see the ocean again rot here.
Backbone of local authorities - incredibly rich oil field.
Settlement, suffering from constant raider’s attacks.
A scientific settlement set on the border of our world and the source of alien radiation.
Whole Oasia dreads this place. This is where the madmen gather, ready to kill anyone. And from here they begin their bloody campaigns.
Gas station

A source of wealth for the North Path Traders’, supplying them with dozens of tons of rare goods every month, perfectly preserved in the weather conditions of Hel. Unfortunately, the native population does not always react adequately to the arrival of foreigners, so the city is very well fortified.
A fishing village by the ocean. "Real fishermen never die" - a local proverb proudly states.
A village at the intersection of all roads.
Settlement by the ruins.
Even swampy soil bears bountiful fruit if it is carefully cultivated one day at a time.
A remote mining village. The locals - fishermen at heart - are upset about this situation.
A village allied with the merchants.
This distant druids’ village serves as a refuge to the people who are tired from the war with machine worshipers.
Old military base, inhabited by the aggressive madmen. There are few people who passed through it alive.
The dwelling of a solitary druid. Whether he had become disgusted with the world or had become an outcast, history does not tell us.
Though this vehicle doesn’t look impressive, practically every part of it is unique.
It's just a race car made out of a bunch of junk parts.
